009package ImageJ_Demos;
010
011import ij.IJ;
012import ij.ImagePlus;
013import ij.plugin.PlugIn;
014import ij.process.ImageProcessor;
015
016/**
017 * This plugin does the same as {@link My_Inverter_A} but is based on the {@link ij.plugin.PlugIn}
018 * instead of the {@link ij.plugin.filter.PlugInFilter} interface. Its advantage is that only one
019 * method (run()) must be implemented. Disadvantage is that testing if an image
020 * is currently open and is of the proper type must be explicitly coded.
021 * @author WB
022 */
023public class My_Inverter_B implements PlugIn {
024
025        public void run(String args) {
026                ImagePlus im = IJ.getImage(); // WindowManager.getCurrentImage();
027                
028                if (im.getType() != ImagePlus.GRAY8) {
029                        IJ.error("8-bit grayscale image required"); 
030                        return;
031                }
032                
033                ImageProcessor ip = im.getProcessor();
034                int M = ip.getWidth();
035                int N = ip.getHeight();
036
037                // iterate over all image coordinates
038                for (int u = 0; u < M; u++) {
039                        for (int v = 0; v < N; v++) {
040                                int p = ip.get(u, v);
041                                ip.set(u, v, 255 - p);
042                        }
043                }
044                
045                im.updateAndDraw();             // redraw the modified image
046        }
047
048}
